2W0221








[solution]		 _____ 2W0222








[solution]      [Next]
2W0223








[solution]		 _____ 2W0224








[solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0221
    • 1. Re8 f6+ 2. Bxf6 black must give
    • up the exchange to avoid mate
    • He can delay things with Rxf4+ but
    • not that it matters.

    		_____
  • 2W0222
    • There are two amazing ways to mate
    • here. The first is 1. Qxh8+! Kxh8
    • 2. Rf8 mate! The second is 1. Rf5+
    • followed by 2. Qg5 mate!

  • 2W0223
    • Not 1. Bxd6 Nxd1. Instead 1.
    • Be5!!! win a pin on
    • the knight on b2. i.e. 1. ...
    • Nxd1 2. Bxa1 or 1. ... Rb1 2.
    • Bxb2 wins.

    		_____
  • 2W0224
    • Not 1. dxc8=Q Rxd1 mate. Instead
    • 1. Nxe6+!! forking
    • the king and rook. Then if 1.
    • ... fxe6 2. dxc8=Q with check wins
    • easily.

    2W0225








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0226








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0227








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0228








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0225
    • 1. Bxg4+ mates next move. 1. ...
    • Kh6 2. Nf7 mate
    • 1. ... Kh4 or 1. ... Kxg4 Qh3
    • mate
    • Also works is 1. Qh3+ Kg6 2.
    • Bd3 mate.

    		_____
  • 2W0226
    • 1. Bxg7+ Kxg7 2. Nf5+ makes an
    • discovered attack on the queen by
    • the rook on d1. Black could play 1
    • .... Kg8 but would lose his rook on
    • f8.

  • 2W0227
    • 1. Qe2 stopping mate and now the
    • knight is pinned
    • because if it moves then 2. Re8+
    • leads to mate. So the knight drops
    • on
    • move .2

    		_____
  • 2W0228
    • 1. Bxc6 wins at least two pawns.
    • if bxc6 then 2. Qxc6+ forks the
    • king and the rook. Otherwise if 1.
    • ... Nd7 2. Bxb7 picking up a
    • second pawn.

    2W0229








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0230








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0231








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0232








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0229
    • 1. Rc8 wins the bishop on d8. The
    • immediate threat
    • is 2. Nf6+. If 1. ... Re7 2.
    • Rxd8 wins. If instead 1. ... Kg7
    • 2. Rb8
    • wins the bishop

    		_____
  • 2W0230
    • Although 1. Nc6+ is good, much
    • better is 1. Qxd7+
    • which mates on move 2. I.E. 1.
    • ... Qc7 2.Qxc7 mate!
    • Or if the king moves then 2. Qb7
    • mate!

  • 2W0231
    • 1. Bd3 (only safe square for the
    • bishop. ) and white
    • wins because the black bishop
    • can't espape attack on move 2.
    • if 1. ... Rc3 2. Ke2 wins.

    		_____
  • 2W0232
    • This should look very familar. It
    • happened to me
    • about 4 times playing on the
    • internet over 2 days! The
    • solution is 1.
    • Qh8 g2 2. Qxh4+ with a won
    • endgame.

    2W0233








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0234








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0235








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0236








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0233
    • From a Petrosion game.
    • 1. g5!! and the black queen has
    • nowhere to hide so Qxe7
    • 2. dxe7 and the knight must
    • move away from the defnese of the
    • bishop.
    • Black resigned.

    		_____
  • 2W0234
    • White mistakenly played 1. R2e7
    • which black can defend with Rb5.
    • Instead much better is 1. Rb2 which
    • will either win the pawn on b7 or
    • give white a good endgame after 1.
    • ... Rb5 2. Rxb5

  • 2W0235
    • 1. Rxf7 and there is no place on
    • the board for the
    • Queen to hide. i.e. 1. ... Qh4
    • 2. Rf4+ wins the Queen. 1. ...
    • Qa6 2.
    • Rxa7+ 1. ... Qxf2+ 2. Rxf2+
    • 1. ... Qd8 2. Rd7+

    		_____
  • 2W0236
    • I watched this amazing combo in a
    • fast blitz game between BarryH and
    • Utah on the Inernet Chess Club.
    • 1. Nxe5! threatening the Queen by
    • the bishop on e2. If 1. ... Qh4
    • 2. Nf2 mate. If 1. ... Qxh6 2.
    • Nf7+ wins the Queen. Qe8 White
    • wins pawn.
